thread.title: Mustang football keeps humming along, dominates winless Clarke
thread.title_full: Mustang football keeps humming along, dominates winless Clarke

title: Mustang football keeps humming along, dominates winless Clarke
text:
Mustang football keeps humming along, dominates winless Clarke Published: Monday, Oct. 12, 2015 11:19 a.m. CDT • Updated: Monday, Oct. 12, 2015 11:20 a.m. CDT By Troy Hyde Newton Daily News 
OSCEOLA — Logan Gilman threw for 362 yards and two scores, Logan Littrell rushed for 97 yards and two scores and Tyler Dredge had a 69-yard touchdown reception during the Mustangs’ 42-6 win over Clarke in Class 2A District 7 action on Friday. 
PCM’s defense had two interceptions and two fumble recoveries. Dredge had one of each as he finished with five catches for 131 yards on offense. 
Luke Greiner tallied seven catches for 105 yards and a score. Noah Clark hauled in four passes for 88 yards. Wes Cummings had 57 rushing yards and two scores. 
The Mustangs, who have won six straight games, led 14-0 after one quarter and 28-6 at halftime. 
Littrell and Cummings each had touchdown runs in the first quarter. Littrell added his second score in the second and Gilman’s first touchdown pass went to Greiner in the second quarter. 
Cummings made it 35-6 after three quarters with a 2-yard touchdown run. Gilman hooked up with Dredge on a 69-yard touchdown pass in the fourth quarter to cap the scoring. 
Gilman finished 19-for-26 through the air. Littrell had two catches for 39 yards to go with his 97 rushing yards. Clayton Welch ran for 31 yards on four carries. 
The Mustang defense was led by Nathan Trausch, who finished with six tackles and a sack. 
PCM recorded four sacks on the night — one each by Welch, Leevi Telfer and Ethan Thomas. 
Telfer and Colton Warrick each had 4.5 tackles, while Reid Jenkins and Dredge each recovered a fumble. 
Chase Wilkie was 6-for-6 in PATs and six of his seven kickoffs were touchbacks. 
Clarke (0-7, 0-5) was defeated for the 24th straight time. 
PCM (6-1, 4-0) travels to top-ranked Albia Friday for a chance at the District 7 championship. Kickoff is at 7:30 p.m. 
The Mustangs host playoff contender North Polk in Week 9, but a win over the Blue Demons would go a long way in claiming the district title. 
PCM and Albia sit at 4-0 in district play, while North Polk is 3-1. All three teams locked up postseason berths after wins on Friday. CMB is 2-2 in district play. 
North Polk (4-3) controls its own destiny for the No. 2 seed as it hosts CMB (5-2) Friday and travels to PCM in Week 9. 
Prairie City-Monroe 14-14-7-7—42 
PCM — Littrell 8-yd run (Wilkie kick) 
PCM — Cummings 1-yd run (Wilkie kick) 
PCM — Littrell 1-yd run (Wilkie kick) 
Clarke — Olin 12-yd pass from Wilkins (missed kick) 
PCM — Greiner 3-yd pass from Gilman (Wilkie kick) 
PCM — Cummings 3-yd run (Wilkie kick) 
PCM — Dredge 69-yd pass from Gilman (Wilkie kick)
